title: BAE Systems wins $365 million contract to build geostationary weather instrument
summary: BAE Systems, the former Ball Aerospace and Technologies Corp., won a $365 million contract May 1 to develop an air quality sensor for a U.S. geostationary weather satellites.

title: NRO’s first batch of next-generation spy satellites set for launch
summary: The agency’s principal deputy director Troy Meink said the NRO is targeting a May 19 launch of NROL-146

title: A religious test for space exploration?
summary: As we move off planet Earth, we will take all our celebrations, rituals and memorials with us, including our funerals and our memorial services, even as we create new ones

title: Rocket Lab prepares for back-to-back launches for NASA
summary: Rocket Lab is preparing for back-to-back missions for NASA, which will see them launch twice within three weeks from Launch Complex 1...

summary: The devil, as always, is in the details.

title: Nurturing U.K. expertise: a strategic imperative in the emerging space era
summary: The U.K. government must embrace academia, capitalize on private investment in the sector and continue to foster partnerships among the three — and seek opportunities to strengthen them in areas where they are weak.

title: Daily Telescope: The Horsehead Nebula as we’ve never seen it before
summary: Webb delivers with a new look on an iconic classic.

title: Astroscale to go public on Tokyo exchange
summary: Astroscale, the satellite servicing and debris removal company, will go public on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in June.
